description: Safety content for Threshold Compass - SSOT for all harm reduction

absolute.name: Lithium
absolute.description: Lithium combined with psychedelics can cause seizures and serotonin syndrome. This is a medical emergency risk.
absolute.message: Lithium and psychedelics are a dangerous combination. We cannot in good conscience allow you to proceed. Please consult a healthcare provider.

absolute.name: MAOIs (Monoamine Oxidase Inhibitors)
absolute.description: MAOIs dramatically potentiate psychedelics and can cause serotonin syndrome. Examples: phenelzine, tranylcypromine, isocarboxazid, selegiline.
absolute.message: MAOIs dramatically increase psychedelic effects and can be dangerous. This combination is not safe. Please consult a healthcare provider.

absolute.name: Tramadol
absolute.description: Tramadol lowers seizure threshold and has serotonergic activity. Combined with psychedelics, seizure risk increases significantly.
absolute.message: Tramadol combined with psychedelics increases seizure risk. We cannot allow you to proceed. Please consult a healthcare provider.

relative.name: SSRIs
relative.description: SSRIs reduce psychedelic effects due to 5-HT2A receptor competition. Higher doses may be needed, which increases risk. Examples: fluoxetine, sertraline, citalopram.
relative.message: SSRIs can reduce psychedelic effects. Some people need higher doses to feel effects, which carries additional risk. Proceed with caution and consider discussing with your prescriber.

relative.name: Antipsychotics
relative.description: Antipsychotics block the effects of psychedelics. If you're prescribed these, there may be important reasons. Stopping them to use psychedelics is not recommended.
relative.message: Antipsychotics are prescribed for important reasons. Stopping them to use psychedelics is not recommended without professional guidance.

relative.name: Heart Conditions
relative.description: Psychedelics can temporarily increase heart rate and blood pressure. Those with cardiovascular conditions should proceed with caution.
relative.message: Psychedelics can affect heart rate and blood pressure. If you have a heart condition, please consult with a healthcare provider before proceeding.

relative.name: Personal or Family History of Psychosis
relative.description: Psychedelics can trigger psychotic episodes in predisposed individuals. Those with personal or family history of schizophrenia, bipolar I, or psychosis should exercise extreme caution.
relative.message: A history of psychosis or schizophrenia increases risk with psychedelics. Please consult a mental health professional before proceeding.

relative.name: Pregnancy or Breastfeeding
relative.description: Effects of psychedelics on fetal development are unknown. Not recommended during pregnancy or breastfeeding.
relative.message: Psychedelic use during pregnancy or breastfeeding is not recommended due to unknown effects on development.
